code:
import turtle

wn = turtle.Screen()
wn.bgcolor('white')

t1 = turtle.Turtle()
t1.color('red')
t1.penup()
t1.goto(-100,0)

t2 = turtle.Turtle()
t2.color('yellow')
t2.penup()
t2.goto(0,0)

t3 = turtle.Turtle()
t3.color('blue')
t3.penup()
t3.goto(100,0)

guide.img: In this lesson, we are going to create three turtle objects and assign separate features for all three of them.
For the first turtle object, we are going to place it at -100 on the x-axis and set the colour as red
guide.code:
import turtle

wn = turtle.Screen()
wn.bgcolor('white')

t1 = turtle.Turtle()

guide.img: For the second turtle object, we are going to place it at 0 on the x-axis and set the colour as yellow
guide.code:
import turtle

wn = turtle.Screen()
wn.bgcolor('white')

t1 = turtle.Turtle()
t1.color('red')
t1.penup()
t1.goto(-100,0)

t2 = turtle.Turtle()

guide.img: For the third turtle object, we are going to place it at 100 on the x-axis and set the colour as blue
